name: bibliographical
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to a bibliography (= a list of the books, etc. that have been used when writing a particular book or article, or a list of the books from a particular writer or publisher or on a particular subject): Further bibliographical references will be given below. He provides bibliographical notes that show his familiarity with current historical research. Bibliographic references are cited within the text.
relating to libraries and the books and information they contain: Computerised library catalogues are just one example of the many forms of computerised bibliographical information which are available. A team of professional librarians is headed by the bibliographical services officer. a database of bibliographic information Related word
bibliography
More examplesFewer examplesThe volume includes bibliographical references and an index.Thorough bibliographical footnotes allow others to duplicate and confirm the results of research. Many of his books include an extended bibliographical essay in which he briefly discusses the works he has learned from.The library is carrying out a comprehensive bibliographical survey of the subject, to discover what literature exists and what is lacking in current library stock.
